required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

clinical_study.source: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

brief_summary.textblock: The DiamondTemp™ Global Registry is a prospective, global, multi-center, observational post-market registry.

detailed_description.textblock: The DiamondTemp™ Global Registry is a prospective, global, multi-center, observational post-market registry. The purpose of this clinical study is to describe clinical performance and safety data in a broad patient population treated with the commercially available DiamondTemp™ Family of Cardiac Ablation Catheters (hereafter referred to as the DiamondTemp™ Ablation System) and followed according to the standard of care at each respective institution. The follow up period is intended to align with standard practice and subjects will be followed for a minimum of 12 months post-procedure.

primary_outcome.description: Estimate the 12-month freedom from recurrence of the arrhythmia(s) treated at the study index ablation procedure using the DiamondTemp™ Ablation System.

primary_outcome.measure: Freedom from Device / Procedure Related Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Estimate serious device and serious procedure-related adverse events for ablation using the DiamondTemp™ Ablation System through 12 months.

arm_group.description: Patients enrolled and treated with the DiamondTemp™ Ablation System

intervention.description: A cardiac ablation will be performed using the DiamondTemp™ Ablation System.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects ≥ 18 years of age (or minimum age as required by local regulations) who have a recommendation for an ablation with the DiamondTemp™ Ablation System may be approached regarding enrollment in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is ≥ 18 years of age or minimum age as required by local regulations
- Planned procedure using commercially available DiamondTemp™ Ablation System
- Willing to comply with study requirements and give IC (defined as legally effective, documented confirmation of a subject's voluntary agreement to participate in this clinical study) or authorization per institution and geographical requirements
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject is enrolled in a concurrent study that has not been approved for concurrent enrollment by the global study manager
- Subject with exclusion criteria required by local law
